messages.title: A better deal for Bath
messages.content: I’ve never been afraid to stand up for my community or take on powerful people. I’m known for getting things done. But it’s pointless becoming an MP before you have experienced the real world outside politics. I have been pretty successful in my own careers including being a teacher and a journalist, and I’m also the mother of four children aged 20 to 27. I will not shirk from representing the people of Bath and their beliefs, whatever the pressure I am under. I hope you will choose to put your trust in me on 8th June.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Schools: Why won’t the Government listen?
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Local schools are under threat from a Conservative Party that has stopped listening to local people in Bath. Conservative cuts to our schools mean fewer teachers and bigger classes. Schools in B&NES are set to lose £8,048,029 from their budgets. Wera Hobhouse will fight for a better deal on schools funding.

Conservative cuts have left our NHS in dire trouble. Waiting lists are longer, operations cancelled, A&E under pressure as never before. Liberal Democrats are clear that our national healthcare system must provide high quality care to all – across both mental and physical health. Unlike other parties, the Lib Dems have explained how they would give the NHS and Social Care an extra £8m per year.

mentions.otherPartyLeaderCandidate: Labour’s collapsing support. Conservatives on Brexit.

issues.brexitEurope: Challenging the damaging Hard Brexit. Conservatives’ bad Brexit deal.
